title: C3 Component Level Schema
description: Template for C3 (Component) level C4 model documentation. Components are the building blocks inside a container that work together to deliver the container's functionality.

components._comment: EXAMPLE COMPONENT - Complete template showing all available fields
components.name: User Authentication Service
components.responsibility: Handles user authentication, token generation, and session management

structure._comment: Code structure information - physical location and organization

patterns._comment: Design patterns used in this component
patterns.name: Singleton
patterns.description: AuthService uses singleton pattern to ensure single instance manages all authentication state

patterns.name: Strategy Pattern
patterns.description: Multiple authentication strategies (JWT, OAuth, Session) implemented using strategy pattern

patterns.name: Dependency Injection
patterns.description: TokenManager and SessionStore injected via constructor for testability

metrics._comment: Code quality metrics for this component

observations.description: Well-structured use of Strategy pattern for authentication methods
High cyclomatic complexity in authenticate() method suggests need for refactoring
Direct dependency on deprecated bcrypt library version
Comprehensive unit tests with good coverage of edge cases
Token validation logic could be simplified using validator chain pattern
Clear separation of concerns between authentication and session management

relations.description: Uses UserRepository to fetch and validate user credentials
Owns and manages TokenManager lifecycle for JWT operations
Publishes authentication events for audit logging
Subscribes to user creation events to initialize authentication
References SessionStore for managing active user sessions
Extends BaseService for common service functionality

_documentation.title: C3 Component Template Documentation

frontmatter_requirements.description: Generated markdown files MUST include YAML frontmatter with these fields

required_fields.id: Component ID (kebab-case, must match JSON id field)
required_fields.title: Component name (human-readable, matches name field)
required_fields.type: Component type (service, controller, repository, model, utility, middleware)
required_fields.container: Parent container ID (must reference existing container)

frontmatter_requirements.example:
---
id: user-authentication-service
title: User Authentication Service
level: c3
type: service
container: backend-api
generated: auto
---

id.description: Unique identifier for the component within the system

type.description: Classification of the component's role in the architecture

container_id.description: ID of the parent container that hosts this component

responsibility.description: Clear, concise description of what this component does
responsibility.example: Handles user authentication, token generation, and session management

path.description: Relative path from repository root to component code

files.description: List of files that comprise this component

exports.description: Public API exported by this component

items.name: Export name
items.type: Export type (class, function, interface, type, constant)

patterns.description: Design patterns identified in this component

description.description: How the pattern is used in this component

lines_of_code.description: Total lines of code (excluding comments and blank lines)

test_coverage.description: Percentage of code covered by tests

definitions.critical: Requires immediate attention (security, bugs, breaking issues)
definitions.warning: Should be addressed (technical debt, performance, maintainability)

description.description: Clear description of what was observed

properties.type: Type of evidence (code-structure, metric, dependency, etc.)

relations.description: Dependencies and relationships with other components

definitions.interface-implementation: Implements a contract defined by another component
definitions.event-publisher: Publishes events consumed by other components
definitions.event-subscriber: Subscribes to events from other components

definitions.loose: Minimal dependency, easy to change independently
definitions.moderate: Some dependency, requires coordination for changes
definitions.tight: Strong dependency, difficult to change independently

description.description: Active voice description of the relationship (e.g., 'Uses X to do Y')

metadata: parent.timestamp must be earlier than current timestamp
components: Each component must have unique id
type must be one of: service, controller, repository, model, utility, middleware
container_id must reference existing container from c2-containers.json
responsibility must be clear and concise
structure.path must be valid relative path
observations array must not be empty
relations array must not be empty
All relation targets must reference valid component IDs
observations: category must be one of defined categories
severity must be critical, warning, or info
description must be clear and actionable
tags should be relevant and searchable
relations: type must be one of defined relation types
coupling must be loose, moderate, or tight

markdown_generation.description: This template is used to generate markdown files via generate-c3-markdown.py script
sections: Observations (grouped by category, sorted by severity)

usage_notes: This template shows ALL available fields - not all are required for every component
observations and relations arrays are required but can be minimal
patterns and metrics are optional but recommended for comprehensive documentation
Use validation script to verify JSON structure before generating markdown
Component IDs must be unique within the system
Container IDs must reference existing containers from c2-containers.json
Timestamps should reflect actual analysis time
Parent timestamp must be earlier than current timestamp

example_minimal_component.description: Minimal valid component with only required fields

observations.description: Simple utility component with clear purpose

relations.description: Used by main service for utility functions
